column4: *** whilst on the topic of Samba shares - I can't seem to play video files properly over a samba share using WinXP...it's very choppy...
what kind of network do you have? its fine here (ubuntu server, ubuntu, xp and osx desktops)
- a normal network ;-) Ubuntu Feisty (not server) and XP client
normal ?
- not sure what you want me to quantify: netgear modem/router, and another hub/switch with a cross-over configured as a client into the netgear, 100MBit LAN - wired
and all machines are running at 100mbit full duplex ?
- yep
- surely I won't need to setup something like VLC just to play video and audio over the network?
I've done exactly the same as you with various ubuntu servers for over a year (and longer with other linux distros) without problem
- and you can play them perfectly from your Samba share on a WinXP client?
- what client player software do you use on XP?
yeah, normally divx though I did stream a DVD once
mediaplayer classic generally
what transfer speeds do you get if you copy say a 600MB file?
- but VLC player should work too, right?
- dunno - will have to try that
yeah it should do - might be worth getting Mediaplayer classic to try it though (its tiny)
- aye, will give media player classic a try - does it support a wide array of vid/audio codecs?
pretty much everything, assuming you have the codecs installed. you can get the nimo or klite codec packs to get everything you'll ever need
- cheers, will let you know how that goes ;-)
- thanks for that - Media PLayer Classic works great!
yeah it's great - maybe VLC does something odd with direct file access
- hmm yeah could be, it did seem to stutter quite a bit - ah well, I'm happy it's not a server issue ;-)
